alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:08PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Knox and northeastern Anderson Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clinton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Clinton, Halls, Norris, Andersonville, Maloneyville, Powell and Norris Dam State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east Tennessee.
